intro: Dysoxylum palawanense, commonly known as the Palawan satinash, is a tropical tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces oval, woody fruits that contain a single seed, and its bark is often used in traditional medicine. Dysoxylum palawanense thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in lowland and hill forest areas.
